results.title: Collide
results.brief_description:
Collide is an interactive artwork comprising 9 images. It was born from a wish to make the viewing of the images a kind of journey- where the movement of the eye and the cursor make a path, mouse clicks causing progression along that path.

Using the metaphor of ‘journey making’ the artist found a way to allow a progression from image to image by way of using a hotspot

results.title: Collection and preservation of evidence. Section I and II
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description: Instructional film portrays homicide investigation, including equipment necessary for the collection and preservation of evidence; examining details of collecting, marking, and preserving all evidence; photographic recording or sketching of the scene of the crime; evaluation of the evidence; questioning of suspects; and solution of the crime.

results.title: Elizabeth Riddell
results.creator_credit: John Erichsen, Australia Council and Royce Smeal Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Videos on Australian Writers: archival writers series II”.
Elizabeth Riddell came to Australia from New Zealand when she was eighteen. She recalls the community of artists and writers in Sydney in the 1930’s and her early experiences as a journalist. During the Second World War Riddell reported from North America and travelled through Europe. On her return to Australia, her long autobiographical poem was published. Riddell discusses the conflict between the demands of her career and her desire to write poetry. She speaks about the discipline of writing and the state of contemporary Australian literature.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Erichsen, Australia Council and Royce Smeal Film Productions

results.title: Coals Coals (Horses and Carts)
results.creator_credit: David Pitt, Francis Gysin and National Coal Board
results.brief_description: The last of the horse-drawn delivery drays of Charringtons. The film is a nostalgic record of the work of the horses and delivery men. There is no glamour, the stables are scruffy, the men dirty, but the horses are immaculate. The title comes from a music-hall song which provides the background music.

results.title: Coaching for the first time
results.creator_credit: Ron Tindall and Dep for Youth, Sport and Recreation, Western Australia
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of what is involved for the newcomer to coaching child athletes. Stresses that winning isn’t everything. Considers the role of the parent as a coach and finally highlights the skills necessary to be a good coach.

results.title: Coaching for improved performance
results.brief_description: In most organisations there are people who would benefit from training. This recognition, that improving employees performance is not a one off process, but one that should be continually developed, is crucial. This video provides managers and supervisors with the skills needed to become successful instructors, or coaches, in the workplace. The video follows a middle level manager in a typically structured organisation, who has recognised that a number of staff could benefit from coaching to improve their performance. Ten key skills of successful coaches are illustrated with practical examples. Pause breaks are included on the tape to allow for integration with the training guide.
